meanings.definition: To take the place of (someone or something) by force or treachery.
meanings.sent1: The new leader tried to supplant the old king by using deceit.
meanings.sent2: In the story, the evil sorcerer plotted to supplant the good wizard from his position of power.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous elf attempted to supplant Santa Claus as the bringer of gifts.
meanings.sent4: The rising star aimed to supplant the established actress as the queen of the silver screen.
meanings.sent5: The ambitious student sought to supplant the teacher as the most knowledgeable in the class.

meanings.definition: To remove or displace (someone or something) from a position of power or authority.
meanings.sent1: The rebels planned to supplant the dictator and establish a new government.
meanings.sent2: The company's board of directors decided to supplant the CEO due to his poor performance.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous monkey tried to supplant the zookeeper and take control of the zoo.
meanings.sent4: The young athlete aimed to supplant the reigning champion and claim the title for himself.
meanings.sent5: The ambitious intern hoped to supplant her supervisor and take over his role in the company.
